DerpySquirrel#1568
Content: I was curious what the `crate= ` does in this usecase. Is that setting it up as a reference/variable?

Author: osodirty
Content:
It's casting to the scripted class since result is inheriting ItemBase and your function needs to be accessed from it's own class.

So basically yes. It's setting up your crate as a variable that can access any function you place inside `class SQCrate_001_Opened` as well as any function down it's inheritance tree. With the exception of constructors/deconstuctors (which you can just add your own), you can also override any function in it's inheritance tree within  `class SQCrate_001_Opened` .
